body_html:
This looks like a mismatch between a google library, probably protobuf, compiled with gcc4.8 in conda-forge which onnx uses and one compiled with gcc7.2 in conda-default channels that Caffe2 uses. Can you try the caffe2-gcc4.8 package or build onnx from source? You can build onnx from source by

git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive
cd pytorch
PROTOBUF_INCDIR=/path/to/anaconda/env/where/caffe2/is/installed pip install third_party/onnx
body_text:
This looks like a mismatch between a google library, probably protobuf, compiled with gcc4.8 in conda-forge which onnx uses and one compiled with gcc7.2 in conda-default channels that Caffe2 uses. Can you try the caffe2-gcc4.8 package or build onnx from source? You can build onnx from source by
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive
cd pytorch
PROTOBUF_INCDIR=/path/to/anaconda/env/where/caffe2/is/installed pip install third_party/onnx
body:
This looks like a mismatch between a google library, probably protobuf, compiled with gcc4.8 in conda-forge which onnx uses and one compiled with gcc7.2 in conda-default channels that Caffe2 uses. Can you try the caffe2-gcc4.8 package or build onnx from source? You can build onnx from source by
```
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git --recursive
cd pytorch
PROTOBUF_INCDIR=/path/to/anaconda/env/where/caffe2/is/installed pip install third_party/onnx
